channel.title: Java hackers?
channel.description:
People are saying that there are java hackers at the moment, as example http://www.theregister.co.uk/2012/08/27/disable_java_to_block_exploit/ http://go.bloomberg.com/tech-blog/2012-08-30-hackers-exploits-of-java-renews-debate-about-pace-of-security-fixes/ http://www.techweekeurope.co.uk/news/oracle-hackers-java-zero-day-flaw-90871
and alot more..
few friends told me about it and told me to disable java.
i did actually notice quite a few times that my mouse started moving by it self (not slowly like actual intended movements) so i closed my server/client and all the other stuff that was running on java and it was gone.
any opinions? or did you have any experiences?
also pls don't hate just wondering

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:31, topic:457369”][quote author=Niall link=topic=560298.msg4095281#msg4095281 date=1346777487]

What’s the Java certificate exploit? Also, how can you avoid it?

disable java support in your browser until a patch is released, java 7 update 7 reportedly has not fixed the issue
[/quote]

What do we tell the Java Update? “NEVER AGAIN”[/quote]
He answered my question but it doesn’t mean that I’ll do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“bibbobbib, post:27, topic:457369”][quote author=Kozs link=topic=560298.msg4095083#msg4095083 date=1346753743]

Java wants your RS accounts because they are poor.

Lol you pay for your rs accounts?

I don’t know how you think I pay for my RS accounts. #StupidFuckLogic
[/quote]

you say they are poor but you don’t need to have cash to make a runescape account…[/quote]

you say they are poor but you don’t need to have cash to get linux…

Read full topic

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

What’s the Java certificate exploit? Also, how can you avoid it?
Everything has it problems over time people find them by exploting the programme/software. I.e. Theirs a lot of abuse when it comes to Flash. Not using them would be paranoid but certain software/applications should be avoided unless your aware how it is being abused then you can avoid the issues for the most part.

Read full topic

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“bibbobbib, post:20, topic:457369”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=560298.msg4092607#msg4092607 date=1346535698]
Linux is much better than Windows in many aspects. Only downside IMO is the lack of Linux support on many programs.
You better hope MITB doesn’t see what you’re saying. He would rip you a new one.
[/quote]

The hell is mitb?[/quote]

The owner of this site.

bibbobbib:

If they had money why did they buy Linux? It makes no sense.

Most linux flavors are free…

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:9, topic:457369”]This will affect users of Java 7:

Only the latest version of Java — Java 7 — was affected in the latest attacks, according to Adam Gowdiak, chief executive officer of Security Explorations. While only Windows machines were being attacked, the other big operating systems — Solaris, Linux, even Apple’s Mac OS — were also vulnerable if users have Java 7 installed, he wrote in an e-mail.[/quote]

:O! Oh shit… I just updates java

Read full topic

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

tyb97:

Aren’t Linux systems virtually virus free unless you’re running something malicious under root?

linux systems are designed in such a way that it’s very difficult to take over the system without user error, such as running a malicious program as root, linux systems are generally very easy to make very secure too, and assuming no user error is involved there is no options to take over a system without the use of an exploit such as the recent java one

arguably though, if anyone was affected by the java exploit under linux at least it would still be user error, allowing java in a browser without a need is a potential security flaw (that has been demonstrated), allowing java in a browser on any user account that is critical is also a user error

Read full topic

item.title: Java hackers?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“bibbobbib, post:11, topic:457369”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=560298.msg4091775#msg4091775 date=1346454370]
Aren’t Linux systems virtually virus free unless you’re running something malicious under root?
[/quote]

Linux users don’t get hacked because they are so poor that there is nothing worth stealing, that’s why macs are targeted…[/quote]

So Linux users are poor and that’s why macs are targeted? I don’t see how that is remotely relevant to mac at all. Linux / Mac don’t get targeted as much as windows is because windows is build for the common person who has no knowledge of their computer and just use it for porn and social networking. Also the Linux is for a poor person is just plain stupidity.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

This will affect users of Java 7:

Only the latest version of Java — Java 7 — was affected in the latest attacks, according to Adam Gowdiak, chief executive officer of Security Explorations. While only Windows machines were being attacked, the other big operating systems — Solaris, Linux, even Apple’s Mac OS — were also vulnerable if users have Java 7 installed, he wrote in an e-mail.
